lines.text: [Cassim has not showed up at the wedding]
Where is he?
[Genie changes into Pumbaa from the Lion King]
Hakuna Matata!
[Changes back]
Whoa. I was having an out of movie experience.
Geronimo! Arapaho! Navajo! Pocahontas.
If you're Al's dad, and the King of Thieves, I just wanna know one thing.
Yeah?
Will you be having the chicken or the sea bass?
Allow me to introduce.
[laughs]
The King of Thieves.
[Genie shrieks, then calls on a walkie-talkie]
All units, we have a Code Red.
Once again, this whole broadcast has been brought to you by Sand. It's everywhere, get used to it.

[multiple Genies are pointing their guns at Cassim]
Do not attempt to move or we'll be shooting ourselves.

[the wedding pavilion starts shaking]
I thought the earth wasn't supposed to move until the honeymoon.
I was so stupid to think I could change him.
Trying to show him a better life wasn't stupid, Al.

[speaking with his hand, high voice]
Leaving him alone with the parrot, that was stupid.
[the Genie has Cassim surrounded; Aladdin tries to push his way through them]
Genie.
Back off, Al, this creep's got a yellow sheet as long as my arm.
Genie meet my dad.

[confused and defeated]
Stand down men. Smoke 'em if you got 'em.
[all other genies disappear leaving him alone]

[as Forrest Gump]
Mama always said, "Magic is as magic does".

[after elephants run over the Magic Carpet]
Oh, they trampled the carpet! That's a little redundant. So this isn't a bad day for you really, is it?
You have violated the perimeter of the Aladdin and Jasmine Wedding.
[activates lasers]
Prepare to be vaporized. Thank You!
[he fires his laser beams at Aladdin and the others, but they avoid them]
Armed and dangerous!
[to Aladdin]
I'd like to see one of those Forty Thieves get within an inch of your wedding.
Uh-Oh. Uh-Oh. Definitely an oracle-tells the future. Uh-Oh.
Your honor, if I may enter a plea of insanity? Because I am CRAZY about this kid!
[noogies Aladdin]
[after Iago comes back]

[breathlessly]
Al's... Dad... Sa'luk...

[picks him up]
Just take a deep breath, Iago. Now what about Aladdin's father?
It's Sa'luk! The guy Al beat! He's not beat; he's back! And he's got Cassim!

[knowingly]
That's his problem! He chose to go back to that life.
Al, I know your dad made a lot of bad choices - but that doesn't mean you have to.
He is your father. How can you do anything else?
[Aladdin turns away and thinks about it]
I'm being as stubborn as he was.
[after a pause]

[smiles]
Show me the way!
Al, you're back! And your front! You're both here!
And your name is?

[with a lisp]
I'm Thor.
You're Thor?

[with a lisp]
Well it hurth.

[after knocking out one of the thieves]
That was for ruining my wedding.
Oh, look, it's a Kodiak moment!
[a Kodiak bear appears and roars ominously]
Put that bear out of here.

[as Bing Crosby]
I'm sure Ali Baba and the boy are on the road to Agrabah right now. Isn't that right, Bob?

[as Bob Hope]
That's right, Bing. How 'bout this town? Is it wild or what? It's like one giant sand trap, and me without my wedgie. Hey, let's give a big hand for Brooke Shields.
Oh look! There's Osiris. Oh, Osiris! Osiris, could we have a word with you?
Squawks.

[after his tail gets stuck in the stone doorway in the cave; he is left with his tail bone; sarcastically]
Oh, this is attractive!

[crying at the wedding]
It's all so magical. I'm not gonna cry. I'm not.
[sobs loudly for several seconds, then loudly blows his nose into Carpet]

[after seeing that Cassim is not in prison with the other thieves]
He's not in there! You didn't capture the King of Thieves?
Because he was not at the hideout!
He had to be there. Where else would he be?

[enterting cautiously]
Apologies, Captain Razoul.

[with Sa'luk]
What?
Well, the Sultan said he won't be able to sentence your prisoners until tomorrow.
What's more important than sentencing my prisoners?
Why, the wedding. Princess Jasmine and Aladdin are finally getting married.
Aladdin! You didn't capture Aladdin with the others?
Why would he be with the forty thieves?
Because his father is The King of Thieves!

[as Chico Marx]
Hey, that's-a no good. What a wedding needs is a theme!

[as Groucho]
Needs a groom too, but let's work with what we have!
[waggles eyebrows]

[offended]
Genie!
It's a joke! I do that.

[holding the Hand of Midas]
After all these years you finally have your treasure!

[taking it from him]
This thing? This almost cost me the ultimate treasure. It's you son, you are my ultimate treasure. I'm just sorry it took me so long to realise it.
Oh, no. The crowd is parting. Who's coming? It's Moses!
Well, they have no where to go. We got them trapped.
We? They are 40 thieves! We are you, a rug, a monkey and me. Wait, don't count me.
Meet your match, Zorro!
Good birdie. Polly want a little?
Say "cracker" and I let you have it on principle!

[Genie's pointing an elephant towards some thieves]
Don't make me use the other end!

[singing]
They're finally getting married!

[singing]
They're finally getting married!

[singing]
They're finally getting married!

[singing]
Look at all these presents!

[singing]
We're finally getting married!

[squeaking]
You're finally getting married!

[singing]
I'm finally getting married!

[singing]
So it goes, short and sweet / they were wed down the street / may their marriage be truly blessed / Happy end to the tale and tomorrow's a sale / So I'd better go home and rest / Here's a kiss and a hug / sure you don't need a rug? / I assure you, the price is right / Well, salaam, worthy friend / come back soon, that's the end / 'Til another Arabian Night!
Does this code have any rules that don't end in death?
It's a strict code.

[with his tail stuck in the door]
How bad is it?
[chatters and pulls Iago free]

[as Mrs. Doubtfire]
Listen to Genie, dear. Genie knows. You've got to get your mind off this incessant waiting.
Bad new, Al. The boutonnieres clash with the cummerbunds!

[Referencing to the crowd of guest]
Genie, isn't it a little late for that?
What? What are you trying to say? Out with it! What-wha...

[Finally notices crowd]
... hehe. They're he-e-ere. OH NO-HO-HO-HO!

[Transforms into The White Rabbit from "Alice In Wonderland"]
I'm late, I'm late, for a very important date!
[Runs out of room]

[pressing Aladdin to the floor]
You don't stand a chance against the King of Thieves!

[grunting]
When I get up, I'll bow to you!

[after knocking Cassim to the floor]
Could I see your invitation?
[after the 'Party in Agrabah' number ends]

[dancing]
'Sa goin' on now! gotta partay! Gotta partay! Help me! I Can't stop myself! Somebody rub the lamp! Somebody rub the lamp! Oh, you know I feel it!
[sees everyone staring at him]
That's enough.

[dressing Jasmine up as Snow White]
And how 'bout that gown? Whether you're dancing with dwarves or simply biting the apple, it says 'I'm a princess for now!'
Uh, Genie...
Hey, it's synergy! The marketing guys are very excited, tests really well.
[grafts Jasmine's head onto Ariel, Minnie Mouse and Jessica Rabbit]

[playing with wedding themes]
Okay, Madonna - don't keep it, just put that in the mix. Wink.
[fills the room with neon signs and flashing lights]
Oh, I see lasers! It's a miracle! He believes!
[as Elvis]
Thank ya very much.
I don't think so.

[back to normal]
Très gauche, right?

[as a wrestling commentator]
He's got him in the half-nelson, now he's got him in the full-nelson! Oh no! The dreaded 'Ozzie Nelson!'

[as Ozzie Nelson]
Rick, boys, maybe you wanna come over here and see what's happening'?
You're a good guy, Cassim. But not too good.
[laughs]
Have you chosen your question?
I have.
Then ask.
Where is my father?

[points off into the distance]
Follow the trail of the Forty Thieves. Your father is trapped within their world.
Forty Thieves? Is he hurt? how long has he been their prisoner?

[vanishing]
I'm sorry, I can only answer one question.

[singing]
There's a party here in Agrabah / Guests are filling up the room / But there's something missing. Yes, uh huh!
Where is the groom?
You killed Sa'luk. The Code of the Forty Thieves is very clear on this point. You're in!

[after the stampede of elephants and thieves leave]
I'll see you again, boy.
Our princess is to wed.

[as a beggar]
Oh, wonderful!

[singing]
There's a party here in Agrabah, and the party's all for me. / Just look, you guys, at where we are, and how our dreams have come to be.

[singing]
There's a party here in Agrabah, and I can't believe it's true. / After all this waiting, here we are. We'll finally get to say, "I do".
I never ever had a real family.
I never ever had a real true friend.
Someone who could just understand me.
one question, one answer.
I only want one answer! Where is the ultimate treasure?
You've already asked your question.

[to Aladdin]
Don't look so solemn, boy. This is a happy day.
Hello? Somebody's gonna be late for his own wedding!
Hold on Genie, there's something I need.

[winks]
I gotcha...
[turns into a woman popping out of a cake]
It's a bachelor party, big boy!

[to Carpet with a mug of beer]
None for you! You're the designated flyer.

[turning a honeydew into a coach]
I don't know whether to put it under props or produce!
[to Jasmine]
Please don't squeeze the tires, they're not ripe.

[as the thieves glare at Aladdin for finishing Sa'luk]
I thought our side won!
But there's nothing here.
Not yet. Open... Caraway!
[pause]
There is still nothing here...
When I get a hold of that no good...
But... I thought you said it was... Open Sesame.
[the ground suddenly rumbles as the entrance to the 40 Theives' hideout opens, Razoul grins]

[singing]
Are you out or in?

[singing]
Make your choice now / Sink or swim?
Maybe you you could elope. No, you can't elope. But, oh, honey dew!
I see all that has been, and all that will be.
Now get off that thing before you break your neck.

[while the thieves pamper him; miserably]
Oh, I love you guys.
The Vanishing Isle will appear at dawn. I'll show you the way.
Well, we're here.
Together, forever.

[seeing the wedding guests assembled for the wedding]
They're here.
[turning into the White Rabbit from "Alice in Wonderland"]
Oh no-ho-ho-ho!
[runs up the aisle and out the door, singing]
I'm late, I'm late, for a very important date.
Okay, let's see, this will be the second wedding for both of you, I'm thinking we need something a little more simple, a little more elegant... and less gray.
[pulls an elephant out of thin air]
Did it, done it, own it.
